notes.text: Important: Updated images are now available for Red Hat Advanced Cluster Security.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Updated images are now available for Red Hat Advanced Cluster Security. The
updated image includes new features and bug fixes.

This release includes the following features and updates:

* New Compliance capabilities (Technology Preview)
* Network graph enhancements for internal entities
* Build-time network policy tools is now generally available
* Init-bundle graphical user interface improvements
* eBPF CO-RE collection method enabled by default
* Bring your own database for RHACS Central is now generally available
* Support RHACS on ROSA hosted control plane
* Life cycle updates
* Integration with Red Hat OpenShift Cluster Manager and Paladin Cloud to discover unsecured clusters
* Migration to stock Red Hat OpenShift SCCs during manual upgrade by using roxctl CLI
* Cluster discovery by using cloud source integrations
* Short-lived API tokens for Central
* Enhanced roxctl deployment check command
* Authentication of AWS and GCP integrations by using short-lived tokens (Technology Preview)
* Scanner V4 that uses upstream ClairCore (Technology Preview)
* Filter workload CVEs by using component and component source

For more information, including bug fix descriptions, see https://docs.openshift.com/acs/4.4/release_notes/44-release-notes.html.

Security fixes:
* golang: net/http: insufficient sanitization of Host header (CVE-2023-29406)
* go-git: Maliciously crafted Git server replies can cause DoS on go-git clients (CVE-2023-49568)
* helm: Missing YAML content leads to panic (CVE-2024-26147)
* helm: Shows secrets with --dry-run option in clear text (CVE-2019-25210)
notes.title: Details

cwe.name: Insertion of Sensitive Information Into Sent Data

notes.text: A vulnerability was found in Helm that may lead to sensitive information disclosure. When the --dry-run flag is used in Helm 3, it displays values of secrets. Helm 2 just displays the fact that a secret has been created.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: helm: shows secrets with --dry-run option in clear text
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: If you are using an earlier version of RHACS, you are advised to upgrade to release 4.4.

vulnerabilities.title: helm: shows secrets with --dry-run option in clear text

notes.text: A flaw was found in the graphql package. Affected versions of this package are vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS) due to insufficient checks in the OverlappingFieldsCanBeMergedRule.ts file when parsing large queries. This issue may allow an attacker to degrade system performance.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: graphql: Insufficient checks in the OverlappingFieldsCanBeMergedRule.ts file when parsing large queries
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: If you are using an earlier version of RHACS, you are advised to upgrade to release 4.4.

vulnerabilities.title: graphql: Insufficient checks in the OverlappingFieldsCanBeMergedRule.ts file when parsing large queries

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of CRLF Sequences in HTTP Headers ('HTTP Request/Response Splitting')

notes.text: A flaw was found in Golang, where it is vulnerable to HTTP header injection caused by improper content validation of the Host header by the HTTP/1 client. A remote attacker can inject arbitrary HTTP headers by persuading a victim to visit a specially crafted Web page. This flaw allows the attacker to conduct various attacks against the vulnerable system, including Cross-site scripting, cache poisoning, or session hijacking.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang: net/http: insufficient sanitization of Host header
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: If you are using an earlier version of RHACS, you are advised to upgrade to release 4.4.

vulnerabilities.title: golang: net/http: insufficient sanitization of Host header

notes.text: A denial of service (DoS) vulnerability was found in the go library go-git. This issue may allow an attacker to perform denial of service attacks by providing specially crafted responses from a Git server, which can trigger resource exhaustion in go-git clients.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: go-git: Maliciously crafted Git server replies can cause DoS on go-git clients
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This problem only affects the go implementation and not the original git cli code. Applications using only in-memory filesystems are not affected by this issue. Clients should be limited to connect to only trusted git servers to reduce the risk of compromise.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: If you are using an earlier version of RHACS, you are advised to upgrade to release 4.4.
In cases where a bump to the latest version of go-git is not possible, a recommendation to reduce the exposure of this threat is limiting its use to only trust-worthy Git servers.

vulnerabilities.title: go-git: Maliciously crafted Git server replies can cause DoS on go-git clients

notes.text: A vulnerability was found in Helm. This flaw may lead to a panic when Helm parses index and plugin yaml files missing expected content, leading to a denial of service.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: helm: Missing YAML Content Leads To Panic
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Red Hat rates this as Moderate since this would impact the Helm client and requires a malicious plugin to be in place, which can be removed.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: If you are using an earlier version of RHACS, you are advised to upgrade to release 4.4.

If a malicious plugin has been added which is causing all Helm client commands to panic, the malicious plugin can be manually removed from the filesystem.

If using Helm SDK versions prior to 3.14.2, calls to affected functions can use recover to catch the panic.

vulnerabilities.title: helm: Missing YAML Content Leads To Panic

cwe.name: Improper Handling of Highly Compressed Data (Data Amplification)

notes.text: A vulnerability was found in Jose due to improper handling of highly compressed data. This issue could allow an attacker to send a JWE containing compressed data that uses large amounts of memory and CPU when decompressed by Decrypt or DecryptMulti.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: jose-go: improper handling of highly compressed data
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details: If you are using an earlier version of RHACS, you are advised to upgrade to release 4.4.

Mitigation for this issue is either not available or the currently available options don't meet the Red Hat Product Security criteria comprising ease of use and deployment, applicability to widespread installation base or stability.

vulnerabilities.title: jose-go: improper handling of highly compressed data
